name: asam laksa
description: A Peranakan noodle dish, paired with sour fish and tamarind-based broth, asam laksa is one of the most iconic Penang dishes.

name: banana leaf rice
description: Banana leaf rice is a traditional South Indian meal where rice and various side dishes are served on a banana leaf.

name: beef rendang
description: Beef rendang is a rich and tender Indonesian beef stew slow-cooked in coconut milk and spices.

name: char kuey teow
description: Char kuey teow is a popular Malaysian stir-fried flat rice noodle dish with shrimp, eggs, Chinese sausage, and bean sprouts.

name: curry laksa
description: Curry laksa is a spicy Malaysian noodle soup with coconut milk, curry, and a mix of seafood or chicken.

name: kaya toast
description: Kaya toast is a traditional Singaporean breakfast of toasted bread with kaya, a sweet coconut and egg jam.

name: maggi mee goreng
description: Maggi mee goreng is a quick Malaysian stir-fried instant noodle dish with vegetables, eggs, and seasonings.

name: murtabak
description: Murtabak is a stuffed, savory pancake or flatbread commonly found in the Arabian Peninsula and Southeast Asia.

name: nasi lemak
description: Nasi lemak is a classic Malaysian dish featuring coconut milk-infused rice served with anchovies, peanuts, boiled egg, cucumber, and spicy sambal.

name: nasi goreng kampung
description: Nasi goreng kampung is a flavorful Indonesian or Malaysian village-style fried rice dish with aromatic spices and often served with anchovies and vegetables.

name: pan mee
description: Pan mee is a Malaysian noodle soup dish made with handmade flat noodles served in a clear broth with minced meat, anchovies, mushrooms, and leafy vegetables.

name: roti canai
description: Roti canai is a popular Malaysian and Singaporean flatbread that is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, typically served with curry or dhal for dipping.

name: satay
description: Satay is a Southeast Asian dish consisting of skewered and grilled meat, typically chicken, beef, or lamb, served with a peanut sauce and often accompanied by rice cakes or cucumber salad.

name: yong tau foo
description: Yong tau foo is a Chinese Malaysian dish featuring assorted tofu and vegetables stuffed with a minced fish paste, served in a clear broth or with a savory sauce.
